message: Printers, and monitors, and Apple's Oh My! I have the back of my truck full of old "green screen" monitors, impact dot matrix printers, a couple of Apple IIe's and a BBC Acorn computer. They have been in storage for decades. I keep thinking the guts and electronics from the dot matrix printers have to be handy for making some cool electromechanical gizmo. But I think they need to move on... to someone else, or to the recycling center. Any interest, or ideas?

I often find myself torn about continuing to store or toss old equipment, parts, or tools. If I knew they could be used by someone else, I'd be happy to donate them to someone's latest project. I thought we could put up lists of "freebies" available for the taking, or even suggestions from others on how to make something useful out of something that is just sitting around collecting dust.

I wonder if the green CRT's would make a good Wobbulator - http://blairneal.com/blog/the-wobbulator/  ..    That may be overkill based on the input mode of these, I've never researched TV or Monitor signals.
Whatever you do, don't throw them out.  Worst case grab a few bucks on ebay and let a collector benefit.
I vote to build a steampunk Apple IIe....and I still want to harvest ribbon cables :)
Nope, not the only one, Kyle.  I've got an old Mac Plus in my basement that I've turned into an aquarium.  I had it on my desk at work for quite a while  - 10 years ago...
